channel.title: Iframe help (or perhaps an alternative?)
channel.description:
here is my code:
[code]<html> <iframe src='http://uk3.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=0&plugin=0' frameborder=0 border=0 width=762 height=503 scrolling=no></iframe> </html>[/code]
problem is I dont want that top bar up there, so if I could somehow get the iframe scrolled all the way to the bottom it would take care of it, and Ive searched on the internet but cant find a way to do it
I need only the client in the window, because I am making a webclient
thanks if you can help :D

so i cant test this stuff[/quote]thats what mcafee privacy does

item.title: Iframe help (or perhaps an alternative?)
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“S!ms, post:20, topic:3327”]I still see a little part of a banner

Maybe this mopar? =>

<html>
<body topmargin="0" leftmargin="0" rightmargin="0" bottommargin="0" bgcolor="#000000">

<div style="position: absolute; width: 100px; height: 100px; z-index: 1; left: 0; top: 0" id="laag1">
	<table border="0" width="762" id="table1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" height="94" bgcolor="#000000">
		<tr>
			<td> </td>
		</tr>
	</table>
</div>

<table border="0" id="table2" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
	<tr>
		<td>

<iframe src='http://uk3.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=0&plugin=0' frameborder=0 border=0 width=762 height=623 scrolling=no name="I1"></iframe>
		</td>
	</tr>
</table>
</html>

It “hides” the banner The menu bar (“Main menu” , Change world" etc) can be hided too ;)[/quote]

i dont think itll work cuz all ur doing is show the top, and since you can’t scroll.
hey i got a great idea, make a js that’ll scroll down instantly for you and lock the scrollbars

=/[/quote]

but that is a thoery[/quote]
Thats sorta what I suggested with making a constant extension to the bot…thinking about what I said earlier though, maybe you don’t need to update it on the server too frequently…I’ll test it out.

item.title: Iframe help (or perhaps an alternative?)
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:30, topic:3327”]omg… hold on im gonna check something…[br][size=1]Posted at: May 30, 2006, 05:04:19 pm[/size][hr]http://train.cruels.net/rstphp/worldconnect.php?w=1&p=0&l=1

that site uses php to load the world

no iframes no nothing

IT DOES NOT LOOK FOR RUNESCAPE.COM!!!

$server = "http://".$prefix.".runescape.com/rs2.cgi?lowmem=".$detail."&plugin=".$java."&affiliate=runescape";

print '<html><frameset cols=0,* rows=0,100% frameborder=1 border=0><frame src="http://www.runescape.com/aff/runescape/logo.html"><frame src="http://ph1.runescape.com:80/aff/runescape/mod/advert/banner.cgi?size=0&rs=1"><frame src="http://ph1.runescape.com:80/aff/runescape/mod/advert/banner.cgi?size=0&rs=1">';
print '<frame src="'.$server.'">';
print '</html>';

u can run the applet on ur site what it requires are the ads if i remember right

but i could be nooby atm so im gonna do some testing[/quote]

You’re right…that site doesn’t use iframes. It uses frames And it also does run directly from runescape.com.

<html>
<frameset cols=0,* rows=0,100% frameborder=1 border=0>
    <frame src="http://www.runescape.com/aff/runescape/logo.html">
    <frame src="http://ph1.runescape.com:80/aff/runescape/mod/advert/banner.cgi?size=0&rs=1">
    <frame src="http://ph1.runescape.com:80/aff/runescape/mod/advert/banner.cgi?size=0&rs=1">
    <frame src="http://uk8.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=1&plugin=0.runescape.com/rs2.cgi?lowmem=1&plugin=0&affiliate=runescape">
</html>

This is apparantly very old because Jagex changed their ad/banner style before…so it’s only the last frame in the above code that displays anything. The others link to non-existant pages. Basically, this no different from what mopar has been working on except that his uses internal frames instead of framesets.

Read full topic

item.title: Iframe help (or perhaps an alternative?)
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

omg… hold on im gonna check something…[br][size=1]Posted at: May 30, 2006, 05:04:19 pm[/size][hr]http://train.cruels.net/rstphp/worldconnect.php?w=1&p=0&l=1

that site uses php to load the world

no iframes no nothing

IT DOES NOT LOOK FOR RUNESCAPE.COM!!!

$server = "http://".$prefix.".runescape.com/rs2.cgi?lowmem=".$detail."&plugin=".$java."&affiliate=runescape";

print '<html><frameset cols=0,* rows=0,100% frameborder=1 border=0><frame src="http://www.runescape.com/aff/runescape/logo.html"><frame src="http://ph1.runescape.com:80/aff/runescape/mod/advert/banner.cgi?size=0&rs=1"><frame src="http://ph1.runescape.com:80/aff/runescape/mod/advert/banner.cgi?size=0&rs=1">';
print '<frame src="'.$server.'">';
print '</html>';

u can run the applet on ur site what it requires are the ads if i remember right

but i could be nooby atm so im gonna do some testing

Read full topic

item.title: Iframe help (or perhaps an alternative?)
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well I will look for a possible server side “spoof”, but at the moment I’m out of ideas

A totally different option would be to create an unchanging applet extension of the client.class to run on your server and just update the RS jar whenever it updates…but then you’d need to figure out how to find out when it updates…

Read full topic

item.title: Iframe help (or perhaps an alternative?)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

BobDole81:

@Bang Train: the point of the client, from what I picked up, is for the client to be loaded from runescape.com. And since the RS applet checks the for the running location, you can’t just use php to grab the html…that’s too easy. That’s also why were were persuing client side alternatives, but I’ve yet to find anything that will alter the code from the client side.

exactly what bobdole said^

the code has to be run from runescape.com, so the only thing that will work is if I can affect what displays inside of a frame or iframe, if I cant do that then I cant do anything

Read full topic

And since the RS applet checks the for the running location, you can’t just use php to grab the html…that’s too easy.
